intro: Dysoxylum kusukusuense, commonly known as the Kusukusu tree, is a tropical tree native to parts of Africa, particularly in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, simple leaves that are usually opposite or alternate in arrangement. The tree produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by fruit that develops into a capsule containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and traditional medicine.
